alert.note: Alert for Appling; Brantley; Pierce; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 11:11PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN PIERCE...NORTH CENTRAL BRANTLEY...SOUTHWESTERN WAYNE AND SOUTHEASTERN APPLING COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1111 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Screven to near Offerman to 6 miles east of Blackshear. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jesup, Patterson, Screven, Offerman, Bristol, Raybon, Hortense, and Broadhurst. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
